publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-360# Christine Grahame: Concessionary Fares for Pensioners—That the Parliament notes that the Transport Bill launched by the Department of Transport in England obliges local authorities to fund at least 50% of a concessionary fare scheme for all pensioners and calls upon the Scottish Executive to initiate a similar scheme in Scotland and to provide resources to meet the necessary funding. Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder
S1M-360# Concessionary Fares for Pensioners (lodged on 7 December 1999) Michael Russell*, Linda Fabiani*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-360# Concessionary Fares for Pensioners (lodged on 7 December 1999) Mr Gil Paterson*, Colin Campbell*

S1M-360# Christine Grahame: Concessionary Fares for Pensioners—That the Parliament notes that the Transport Bill launched by the Department of Transport in England obliges local authorities to fund at least 50% of a concessionary fare scheme for all pensioners and calls upon the Scottish Executive to initiate a similar scheme in Scotland and to provide resources to meet the necessary funding. Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Ms Sandra White, Mr Gil Paterson, Colin Campbell, Fiona Hyslop*
